{'game_id': 284175, 'home_team': 'Manchester City', 'away_team': 'Sunderland', 'text': 'The two managers, old comrades from their playing days with Manchester United, are both in need of a restorative result to get their respective seasons back on track. City have won only one of their last 10 league matches, Sunderland one in eight, and neither of their employers will have expected to lag behind Birmingham at this stage. https://www.theguardian.com/football/2009/nov/06/squad-sheets-wigan-athletic-fulham
{'game_id': 284118, 'home_team': 'Wigan Athletic', 'away_team': 'Fulham', 'text': 'Matches between these sides tend to produce very few goals and with the Wigan manager, Roberto Martínez, claming his side are "light up front" this may be another barren meeting. Fulham will be looking to put Thursday\'s Europa League disappointment behind them and recapture the form that saw them beat Liverpool 3-1 in their last Premier League outing. Damien Duff is likely to be absent for the visitors but Erik Edman could make his first league start for Wigan since March 2008 in place of the injured Maynor Figueroa. https://www.theguardian.com/football/2009/oct/23/squad-sheets-tottenham-hotspur-stoke
{'game_id': 284097, 'home_team': 'Tottenham Hotspur', 'away_team': 'Stoke City', 'text': "The lasting strength of Tottenham's claim to a finish in the top four will be decided by how well Harry Redknapp's squad stand up to the rigours of winter, especially at the back with its recurrent aches and strains. Going forward Spurs have more options and Stoke's away form does not suggest they will be able to deny the opposition a win to stay in third place. However, Tony Pulis's side are nothing if not stubborn and Redknapp may need the lofty presence of Peter Crouch at some time or other to break them down. https://www.theguardian.com/football/2009/oct/02/squad-sheets-west-ham-fulham
{'game_id': 284078, 'home_team': 'West Ham United', 'away_team': 'Fulham', 'text': "It is never too early to start worrying, as your mother might say, and despite both of these teams feeling that they are playing well enough, results have left them peering up at most of the table. Although not one of London's high-profile derbies there is sure to be tension as three points are sought, especially within West Ham's ranks, as they have lost all of their home fixtures. Both managers have strict ball-playing principles which they will not desert, pointing towards a pleasing 90 minutes ,but goals have been in short supply. https://www.theguardian.com/football/2009/sep/18/squad-sheets-everton-blackburn-rovers
{'game_id': 284055, 'home_team': 'Everton', 'away_team': 'Blackburn Rovers', 'text': 'You know Everton\'s season is not going to script when Lee Dixon and Martin Keown are asked whether David Moyes\' team "will be all right?" – as occurred on Match of the Day last Sunday following their defeat at Fulham. Everton have yet to find solidity, balance or invention in the league, unlike Blackburn, who discovered all three in their recent defeat of Wolves. David Dunn was instrumental in that win and a reunion with their former captain Lucas Neill rests on how rusty Moyes deems his new signing to be. https://www.theguardian.com/football/2009/aug/21/squad-sheets-arsenal-portsmouth
{'game_id': 284020, 'home_team': 'Arsenal', 'away_team': 'Portsmouth', 'text': 'Peter Storrie says he has a mystery new backer who will fund a rescue act at Portsmouth. The club would then, presumably, be in a position to meet its scheduled loan repayment of £24-36m by Monday week, meaning it would not have to sell more players and the only way would be up. Excellent. The pessimistic reading as push comes to shove at Fratton Park is somewhat darker. Thank goodness then for respite today, with 90 minutes against a struggling team, whose confidence has been shot to piece by the naysayers. Hang on a minute... Steve Bruce, meanwhile, anticipates a somewhat gruelling afternoon. "Sam is very, very well organised and his teams play to a system which is not always easy on the eye but is very effective," said Sunderland\'s manager. "But these are the games we are going to be judged on." This is the home side\'s third match in a week and, with injuries mounting, it will be intriguing to see if Bruce offers fit crowd favourite Andy Reid a start.
